description: In this tutorial, we show how to calculate and visualize the electronic density of states using our Web Interface, for the simple case of crystalline silicon.
title: Exabyte.io Tutorial: Calculate Electronic Density of States

youTubeCaptions.text: Create a simulation, by navigating to the job designer page.
Then, <break time='0.5' /> open the workflow tab, and choose the 'Band Structure + Density of States' workflow by selecting it in the list.
After that, <break time='0.5' /> navigate to compute tab, and set compute configuration. Here, we use one node with four cores.
Then, <break time='0.5' /> set the name for the job. Here, we call it - Silicon Density of States Computation.
Next, <break time='0.5' /> save the job. <break time='3.0' /> It can then be selected and submitted to the compute queue, for execution. <break time='4.0' />
The status of the calculation will, accordingly, change from submitted, to active.  Please wait, until the job has finished running.
When the job is finished, open it, to inspect the final results. <break time='4.0' />
The electronic density of states plot can be found at the bottom of the results page. This final result is in agreement with the published literature. <break time='3.0' />
